translated: They live in isolated places in the wilderness and have few activities. They are intent on the qualities of training that accord with omniscience, are content, abide in the lineage of the noble ones and are intent on following the diligence of the Dharma.

translated: They are the bodhisattvas’ gaze of satisfaction in accordance with their wishes, without any displeasure,🔽toward those who beg;

original: slong ba la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul khrims la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slong ba la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul khrims la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: their gaze of establishing those with incorrect moral discipline in the moral discipline of omniscience;

original: sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / bzod pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / bzod pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: their gaze of establishing those with malice in the patience of the buddhas through the power of patience;

original: sems can gnod sems can la rnam par lta ba @329b dang; mi gtong ba la brtson pas theg pa chen po la sems can yang dag par dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gnod sems can la rnam par lta ba @329b dang; mi gtong ba la brtson pas theg pa chen po la sems can yang dag par dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: their gaze of establishing sentient beings in the Great Vehicle through their indefatigable diligence;

original: sems can le lo can la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa rnam par 'khrug pa med pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can le lo can la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa rnam par 'khrug pa med pa la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: their gaze of establishing those with laziness in the stage of omniscience, which is free of disturbance;

original: sems can sems rnam par 'khrug pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / the tshom med pas lta ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can sems rnam par 'khrug pa can la rnam par lta ba dang / the tshom med pas lta ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: They are looking at sentient beings with disturbed minds, looking without doubt, looking at all objective references in order to eliminate them,

original: sems can shes rab 'chal ba can la rnam par lta ba dang / ji ltar bstan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal ba can la rnam par lta ba dang / ji ltar bstan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: looking at sentient beings with poor understanding, looking at spiritual teachers in order to be established in the Buddha’s teachings as they are taught,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dge bar rnam par lta ba dang / don gyi mchog nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dge bar rnam par lta ba dang / don gyi mchog nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: looking at the supreme meaning in order to experience it,

original: ji skad du thos pa'i chos la lhag mthong gis rnam par lta ba dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs mi gtang ba'i phyir /🔽sems can thams cad yongs la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du thos pa'i chos la lhag mthong gis rnam par lta ba dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs mi gtang ba'i phyir / sems can thams cad yongs la rnam par lta ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: looking at the Dharma as it is heard with insight, looking at all sentient beings in order not to abandon the power of great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: and looking at all the Buddha’s teachings in order to attain complete enlightenment with omniscient wisdom.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: these are the ten.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par lta ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par lta ba ste /
translated: These are the bodhisattvas’ ways of looking.

original: de dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: de dag la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in them,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par lta ba bla na med par thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par lta ba bla na med par thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
translated: the bodhisattvas attain the highest way of looking with the great wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of noble family!

original: bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' @330a *//🔽rnams kyi rnam par bsgyings pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @330a *// rnams kyi rnam par bsgyings pa ste /
translated: bodhisattvas’ ways of looking.

original: bcu gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang; mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / 'di ltar lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang; mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir /
translated: What are those ten?🔽They are the way of looking that is the bodhisattvas’ lion’s sport, in order to outshine the entire retinue of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas;

original: khyu mchog gi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / shin tu dul zhing cang shes pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / shin tu dul zhing cang shes pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad kyi khur bkur ba'i phyir /
translated: the way of looking that is the bodhisattvas’ overlord’s sport, in order to outshine the entire retinue of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas;

original: glang po'i bsgyings pa dang / chos kyi sprin chen po shin tu 'dus pa las rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i glog 'gyu zhing yang dag par ma nor bar 'brug sgra chen po bsgrags te /
analyzed: glang po'i bsgyings pa dang / chos kyi sprin chen po shin tu 'dus pa las rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i glog 'gyu zhing yang dag par ma nor bar 'brug sgra chen po bsgrags te /
translated: He was the one who, with the great cloud of the Dharma, the great gathering of the majesty of the elephant, the lightning of knowledge and liberation, and the great thunder of the unerring truth,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu'i chos kyi char pa mngon par dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu'i chos kyi char pa mngon par dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: sent down the rain of the Dharma, the water of immortality of the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the dhyānas, the liberations, the samādhis, and the samāpattis.

original: klu'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang; lcag lcig gi spri brtol te /
analyzed: klu'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang; lcag lcig gi spri brtol te /
translated: He was the one who, with the majesty of the nāgas, broke the eggshells and cocoons of ignorance,

original: sred pa'i chu lhag mthong gi gshog pas phye ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i chu lhag mthong gi gshog pas phye ste /
translated: and with the wings of insight and the water of craving,

original: sems kyi sprul 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa can mngon par blang zhing dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi sprul 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa can mngon par blang zhing dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: brought out the snakes of the mind, which are the desires, the disturbances, and the afflictions.

original: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba thams cad med cing /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba thams cad med cing /
translated: the great king of garuḍas,

original: ye shes chen @330b po mnyam pa nyid kyi sder mos ngan par tshogs pa'i phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir /🔽seng ge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa'i dgra gnod par sems pa /
analyzed: ye shes chen @330b po mnyam pa nyid kyi sder mos ngan par tshogs pa'i phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir / seng ge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / 'dod pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa'i dgra gnod par sems pa /
translated: in order to destroy all the māras and opponents with the claws of the sameness of great wisdom.🔽the great lion,

original: gdul dka' ba thams cad dbus nas gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul dka' ba thams cad dbus nas gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to destroy from the middle all the enemies who are difficult to tame, such as the enemies of desire, anger, and the afflictions.🔽the hero,🔽in order to demonstrate the lord of all phenomena with the wisdom that realizes the aggregates, elements, sense sources, and dependent origination.

original: dpa' bo'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir; ye shes kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir; ye shes kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang /
translated: the wisdom,

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pas thos pa thams cad yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pas thos pa thams cad yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They retain all that they have heard through mindfulness, intelligence, and understanding.

original: mi brjed par bzhag pas /
analyzed: mi brjed par bzhag pas /
translated: They establish it without forgetting it.

original: sems can gzhan gyi dbang po'i rgyud du phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi dbang po'i rgyud du phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to bring it to the mindstreams of other sentient beings,

original: gzungs kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / myur zhing mgyogs la dag cing thogs pa med pa dang / chags pa med par tshig thams cad rab tu phye ste bstan pas sems can thams cad tshim par byed cing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi rnam par bsgyings pa dang / myur zhing mgyogs la dag cing thogs pa med pa dang / chags pa med par tshig thams cad rab tu phye ste bstan pas sems can thams cad tshim par byed cing /
translated: they display the dhāraṇīs, and they satisfy all sentient beings by teaching all words with speed, swiftness, purity, unobstructedness, and freedom from attachment.

original: don yod la rmongs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pas spobs pa'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / seng ge'i khri dam pa'i steng du phyin ste /
analyzed: don yod la rmongs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pas spobs pa'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / seng ge'i khri dam pa'i steng du phyin ste /

original: bdud kyi rgol ba thams cad bcom nas /
analyzed: bdud kyi rgol ba thams cad bcom nas /
translated: Having conquered all the attacks of Māra,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir /
translated: they display the perfection of wisdom, having perfected the accumulation of omniscient wisdom.

original: sems @331a *// kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis gang thong bar bya ba de thams cad du /
analyzed: sems @331a *// kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis gang thong bar bya ba de thams cad du /
translated: In a single instant of mind, they attain all that is to be attained through wisdom.

analyzed: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bas sangs rgyas kyi rnam par bsgyings pa'o //
translated: In this way, they manifest the buddha’s majestic bearing by attaining the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras / bcu po de dag ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par bsgyings pa ste /
translated: These are the ten majestic ways of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o zhes sems can la snying rje ba'i seng ge'i nga ro chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi gdung dang / chos kyi gdung dang / dge 'dun gyi gdung mi gcad do //

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba yang dag par mnod pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku zag pa med pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor @335b lo bskor ba dang /

translated: The concentration of pure non-regression from the means of not savoring the taste of concentration, because it still focuses on the desire realm.🔽The concentration of pure generation of the superknowledges and knowledges, because it realizes the faculties of all sentient beings.

translated: What are those ten?

original: rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sems can du 'dzin pa spong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sems can du 'dzin pa spong pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the pure wisdom that knows the causes by means of the method of not wasting the results; the pure wisdom that engages all conditions because it is not in conflict with their assembly; the pure wisdom that is neither eternal nor nihilistic because it knows the way dependent origination occurs; the pure wisdom that is not attached to the extremes of existence and nonexistence because it knows the way of the middle way; the pure wisdom that is not attached to the extremes of grasping at the self because it abandons grasping at sentient beings;

original: lta ba thams cad sel ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad sel ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: the pure wisdom that eliminates all views;🔽the pure wisdom that observes the minds and conduct of all sentient beings in order to examine their illusory nature;

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la rnam par lta ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / tshig gi bye brag thams cad bstan pa thogs pa med par lung bstan pa'i phyir tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen po la 'jug pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkhyen pa dang / mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la rnam par lta ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / tshig gi bye brag thams cad bstan pa thogs pa med par lung bstan pa'i phyir tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen po la 'jug pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkhyen pa dang / mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: the pure wisdom that engages the great knowledge of discerning awareness in order to give prophecies without impediment that teach all the different kinds of words;

original: bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gting dpag dka' pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gting dpag dka' pa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i phyir /
translated: the pure wisdom that is difficult to fathom for all māras, opponents, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas because it follows the knowledge and expertise of all tathāgatas;🔽and the pure wisdom that is in accord with the characteristic of being unattached to anything.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mthong ba dang / sems can thams cad thog ma nas rnam par dag par mthong ba dang / chos thams cad dben par mthong ba dang / zhing thams cad nam @337a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mthong ba dang / sems can thams cad thog ma nas rnam par dag par mthong ba dang / chos thams cad dben par mthong ba dang / zhing thams cad nam @337a *//
translated: the wisdom of seeing the bodies of all the buddhas, seeing all sentient beings as primordially pure, seeing all phenomena as void, and seeing all realms as having the nature of space;

original: mkha'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad la khyad par can gyi ye shes rjes su thob pa'i phyir /🔽gzungs dang spobs pa la brten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / thabs kyi lag pa rkyong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / chos thams cad kyi spyi bor gyur pa'i ye shes rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mkha'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad la khyad par can gyi ye shes rjes su thob pa'i phyir / gzungs dang spobs pa la brten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / thabs kyi lag pa rkyong ba'i shes rab yongs su dag pa dang / chos thams cad kyi spyi bor gyur pa'i ye shes rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir /
translated: the pure wisdom of attaining the special wisdom that is all-pervading;🔽the pure wisdom of the perfection of retention and eloquence, and the wisdom of extending the hand of skillful means;

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes rdo rje lta bu mi 'khrugs shing dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab yongs su dag pa'o //

translated: and the pure wisdom of attaining the wisdom that is the summit of all phenomena, the wisdom of the vajra-like realization of the equality of all phenomena in a single instant of mind, which is characterized by being unshakable and indivisible.

translated: the pure love that is completely protective; the pure love that is never abandoning and is dear to all beings because it focuses on the roots of merit that are conditioned;

translated: the pure love that is completely penetrating in order to cut through the afflictions of all beings;🔽the pure love that is accomplished in the aspects of enlightenment in order to inspire the mind of omniscience in all beings;

original: byang chub kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du 'od zer mnyam par rab tu dgye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / thams cad du 'od zer mnyam par rab tu dgye ba'i phyir /

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i byams pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir /

translated: What are the ten?🔽They are as follows:

translated: Even if all sentient beings serve them, they are not delighted.

translated: They have perfect equanimity in not being angry even when not being served by any sentient beings. They have perfect equanimity in their conduct, being beyond the eight worldly concerns.🔽They have perfect equanimity in not abandoning those who are not vessels for the teachings and in teaching those who are vessels at the appropriate time.

original: snod du gyur pa rnams kyi dus dang yang sbyor ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams par dag pa'i chos thob par gyur pa rnams la rtsol ba gtong ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang /

translated: They have perfect equanimity in not abandoning their efforts with regard to those who have attained the pure dharmas of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, those still in training, and those no longer in training.

analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo dang / longs spyod dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngag tu 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la sems 'brel bar mi gtong ba'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'khor bas skyo ba'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa rnams dang / bsnyen par mi byed pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gtam thams cad dang / mya @340a *//
translated: They have perfect equanimity in not allowing their minds to be involved with any of the pleasures, games, enjoyments, or emotionally tainted speech of the desire realm.🔽They have perfect equanimity in not associating with those who practice the yoga of being weary of saṃsāra in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: ngan las mi 'da' ba dang / 'dod chags dang mi 'bral ba'i gtam dang / mi rigs shing 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gtam dang / gzhan la mtho 'tsham pa'i gtam dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam dang / mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i lam las gol ba'i gtam thams cad dang /
analyzed: ngan las mi 'da' ba dang / 'dod chags dang mi 'bral ba'i gtam dang / mi rigs shing 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gtam dang / gzhan la mtho 'tsham pa'i gtam dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam dang / mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i lam las gol ba'i gtam thams cad dang /
translated: They have perfect equanimity in not associating with any worldly talk, with talk that does not transcend suffering, with talk that does not transcend desire, with talk that is inappropriate and distracting, with talk that is spiteful, with talk of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and, in short, with any talk that strays from the bodhisattva path.

original: 'du ba med pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa dang / blo'i stobs dang / shugs ji lta ba bzhin du gang la yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can de dag gis /🔽de la gong ma'i chos shes par mi nus na yang de dag gi dus bsdad pas btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon yongs su smin par byas pa gang /
analyzed: 'du ba med pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa dang / blo'i stobs dang / shugs ji lta ba bzhin du gang la yongs su smin par byas pa'i sems can de dag gis / de la gong ma'i chos shes par mi nus na yang de dag gi dus bsdad pas btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon yongs su smin par byas pa gang /
translated: It is the complete purity of equanimity with regard to non-gathering.🔽It is the complete purity of equanimity with regard to remaining for as long as those sentient beings who have been brought to full maturity by the power, strength, and force of mindfulness and intelligence are unable to understand the teachings of the higher vehicles.

original: de gzhin  gshegs pa'i sas 'dul bar gyur pa de dag la bsdad pa'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms gnyis dang bral zhing mtho dman med la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms gnyis dang bral zhing mtho dman med la /
translated: “Moreover, O son of noble family, the bodhisattvas are free from two types of equanimity, and so they are without high and low.

original: blang dor med cing rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang bral bas rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing /
analyzed: blang dor med cing rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang bral bas rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing /
translated: They are free from acceptance and rejection, and free from concepts, thoughts, and discursive thoughts. They are always in equipoise.

analyzed: chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gnas pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the pure equanimity of attaining the acceptance of abiding in the perfect realization of phenomena just as they are.

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di ltar nan tan lhur len pa'i phyir thos pa'i don dang / rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir chos kyi don dang / don dam pa stong ba nyid kyi phyir stong pa'i don dang / sems can kyi 'du 'dzis dben pa'i phyir dben pa'i don dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar nan tan lhur len pa'i phyir thos pa'i don dang / rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir chos kyi don dang / don dam pa stong ba nyid kyi phyir stong pa'i don dang / sems can kyi 'du 'dzis dben pa'i phyir dben pa'i don dang /
translated: They are the purpose of listening for the sake of practice, the purpose of the Dharma for the sake of expertise in analysis, the purpose of emptiness for the sake of ultimate emptiness, the purpose of solitude for the sake of being free from the busyness of sentient beings, the purpose of the branches of awakening for the sake of the path, the purpose of the perfections for the sake of the result, the purpose of the result for the sake of the qualities of the result, the purpose of the qualities of the result for the sake of the benefit of others, the purpose of the benefit of others for the sake of the benefit of oneself, and the purpose of the benefit of oneself for the sake of the benefit of others.

original: sems can gyi sgra la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i don dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin gyi don dang / ro mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i don dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi sgra la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'i don dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin gyi don dang / ro mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i don dang /
translated: It is the meaning of the realm of phenomena because it is the equality of taste.🔽It is the meaning of suchness because it follows suchness.🔽It is the meaning of the limit of reality because it realizes the limit of reality.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi don dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha'i don dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po yang dag par gcad cing /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi don dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha'i don dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po yang dag par gcad cing /
translated: It is the meaning of the great nirvāṇa because it severs the mass of suffering

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa bskyed pa'i phyir /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub pa bskyed pa'i phyir / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i don to //
translated: and generates the accomplishment of bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: these ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don te /

analyzed: de dag la gnas shing /

translated: They are the attainment of the unsurpassed, ultimate wisdom of omniscience by bodhisattvas.

translated: “O son of the victors,

translated: these are the ten dharmas of bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du bya ba'i phyir bden pa'i chos dang / len cing 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'bar ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa med pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du bya ba'i phyir bden pa'i chos dang / len cing 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'bar ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa med pa'i chos dang /
translated: They are the Dharma of truth in order to act in accordance with one’s words; the Dharma of non-grasping in order to cut through all grasping and clinging; the Dharma of non-dispute in order to pacify all the burning afflictions;

original: yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba'i chos dang / 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos dang / dmigs pa thams cad rgyun chad pa'i phyir yongs su rtog pa med pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba'i chos dang / 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos dang / dmigs pa thams cad rgyun chad pa'i phyir yongs su rtog pa med pa'i chos dang /
translated: the Dharma of peace because it is free from all torment, the Dharma of freedom from desire because it is free from the stains of desire and all afflictions, the Dharma of non-imagination because it is the cessation of all reference points,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi chos dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi chos dang /
translated: the Dharma of non-arising because it is similar to and equal with space, the Dharma of the unconditioned because it is free from arising, destruction, and abiding, the Dharma of the nature because it is naturally free from affliction,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub cing /🔽yongs su gzung ba'i phyir phung po thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bsgrub cing / yongs su gzung ba'i phyir phung po thams cad spangs te /
translated: the Dharma of the bodhisattvas because it is the basis for the practice of the bodhisattva conduct,

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i chos so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of the abandonment of all the aggregates because it is the basis for the attainment of the bodhisattva conduct,🔽and the Dharma that leads to nirvāṇa because it is the basis for the attainment of the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: these are the ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos te /
translated: dharmas of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: de dag la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in those,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
translated: bodhisattvas attain the unsurpassable nature of the thus-gone ones.

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of noble family!

analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the ten

original: @341b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: @341b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
translated: accumulations of merit of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir /🔽pha rol byang chub kyi sems la yi dam 'char gzhug pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang zhing dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir / pha rol byang chub kyi sems la yi dam 'char gzhug pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang zhing dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They are the accumulation of merit that comes from establishing others in the mind of awakening in order to ensure that the lineage of the Three Jewels is never interrupted;🔽the accumulation of merit that comes from following the ten kinds of dedication in order to abandon all nonvirtuous qualities and gather all virtuous qualities;

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i rnam pa bcu'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / 'jig rten gsum gyi bsod nams zil gyis ngan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i rnam pa bcu'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / 'jig rten gsum gyi bsod nams zil gyis ngan pa'i phyir /
translated: the accumulation of merit that comes from the power of the bodhisattvas’ aspirations in order to surpass the merit of the three worlds;

original: shes rab dang ye shes bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad pha rol gyi mthar bsgral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad pha rol gyi mthar bsgral ba'i phyir /
translated: the accumulation of merit of teaching wisdom and gnosis;🔽the accumulation of merit of never tiring of delivering all realms of sentient beings to the other shore;

original: yongs su skyo ba med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / yongs su bzung ba thams cad gtong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su skyo ba med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / yongs su bzung ba thams cad gtong ba'i phyir /
translated: the accumulation of merit of giving away all inner and outer things in order to give away all possessions;

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pas sems kyi sgo gtan 'byed cing mchod sbyin rab tu bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pas sems kyi sgo gtan 'byed cing mchod sbyin rab tu bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the accumulation of merit of perfecting the major and minor marks by opening the door of the mind through great diligence and making offerings;

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / thabs dang tshul dang 'thad pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / thabs dang tshul dang 'thad pas yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: and the accumulation of merit of being sustained by means, methods, and reasonings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rab 'bring dang / tha mas rlom sems med par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / skyes bu dam pa'i rnam par gnon pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /🔽yang dag pa dang / log par nges pa dang / @342a *//🔽nyam dma' zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams la brnyas pa med cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rab 'bring dang / tha mas rlom sems med par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / skyes bu dam pa'i rnam par gnon pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir / yang dag pa dang / log par nges pa dang / @342a *// nyam dma' zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams la brnyas pa med cing /
translated: the accumulation of merit of the display of the sublimity of holy beings,

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas yongs su skyong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas yongs su skyong ba'i phyir /
translated: the accumulation of merit of the great compassion that is without contempt for those who are lowly and who have not accumulated roots of virtue;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston pa ltar dben par sems pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa byed pa la brtson pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston pa ltar dben par sems pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa byed pa la brtson pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang /
translated: the accumulation of merit of the worship and service of all the tathāgatas, the attitude of regarding all bodhisattvas as teachers, and the diligence in doing whatever needs to be done for all sentient beings;

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskal pa grangs med par bsags shing yongs su bsdus te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskal pa grangs med par bsags shing yongs su bsdus te /
translated: “They have accumulated and gathered the roots of virtue for countless eons.

original: lag pa'i mthil du byin cing bdag la dbang yod par gyur pa'i byang chub kyang sems can la la zhig la yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil du byin cing bdag la dbang yod par gyur pa'i byang chub kyang sems can la la zhig la yongs su btang ste /
translated: They have given away their enlightenment, which they have in the palm of their hand, to some beings.

original: byin na mi dga' ba med la 'gyod pa med cing /🔽de bzhin du sems can ma lus pa thams cad la yang rang la dbang yod par yongs su bsdus te /
analyzed: byin na mi dga' ba med la 'gyod pa med cing / de bzhin du sems can ma lus pa thams cad la yang rang la dbang yod par yongs su bsdus te /
translated: They have given it away without regret and without any sense of loss.🔽In the same way, they have gathered and given away their enlightenment, which they have in the palm of their hand, to all beings without exception.

original: lag pa'i mthil du phyin pa'i byang chub yongs su btang ste; byin yang mi dga' ba med la phyis 'gyod pa med pa 'di ni /
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil du phyin pa'i byang chub yongs su btang ste; byin yang mi dga' ba med la phyis 'gyod pa med pa 'di ni /
translated: They have given it away without regret and without any sense of loss.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nam mkha'i dbyings rgya chen po'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nam mkha'i dbyings rgya chen po'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “This is the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of merit called ‘the vast expanse of space.’

original: ye shes chen po yangs pa khong du chud pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po yangs pa khong du chud pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause for attaining the vast, great wisdom.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: These are the ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs @342b te; de dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs @342b te; de dag la gnas shing /
translated: They are the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of merit, and by relying on them

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur pa dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur pa dag go /
translated: the bodhisattvas attain the thus-gone ones’ unsurpassed great accumulation of merit.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of noble family!

original: bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: accumulations of wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?🔽They are as follows:

original: 'di ltar bsam pa sgyu med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa sgyu med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to be free from deceit,

original: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang du thos pa rnams la bsten pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / gus par bya ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang du thos pa rnams la bsten pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / gus par bya ba dang /
translated: they are the accumulation of wisdom of relying on, venerating, serving, respecting, honoring, revering, and respecting the words of many learned and authentic spiritual friends;

original: bka' blo bde zhing mthun par len pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag snod du bya ba'i phyir nga rgyal med cing /
analyzed: bka' blo bde zhing mthun par len pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag snod du bya ba'i phyir nga rgyal med cing /
translated: the accumulation of wisdom of being free from pride in order to become a vessel;

original: 'dud pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / rab tu gus pa dang / lus dang sems las su rung ba dang / khong bde ba dang / mi slu ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / des shing 'jam la mnyen pa dang / bzhin 'dzum zhing khro gnyer med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dud pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / rab tu gus pa dang / lus dang sems las su rung ba dang / khong bde ba dang / mi slu ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / des shing 'jam la mnyen pa dang / bzhin 'dzum zhing khro gnyer med pa dang /
translated: It is to be humble, to bow, to pay homage, to be very respectful, to have a flexible body and mind, to have a happy heart, to be honest, to be gentle, to be soft, to be kind, to have a smiling face, and to be free of frowns.

original: 'dor te gsong por smra ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mi 'chos pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / ye shes rnam pa bcu la rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir dran pa shes bzhin dang /
analyzed: 'dor te gsong por smra ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mi 'chos pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / ye shes rnam pa bcu la rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir dran pa shes bzhin dang /
translated: It is to be without deceit, to be without pretense, to have the accumulation of wisdom, and to apply oneself to the ten aspects of wisdom.

original: rtogs pa khong du chud pa dang / blo gros mi g-yeng ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / mos pa la rab tu gnas pa dang / rjes su dran par bya ba drug dran pa dang / gus pa drug yongs su bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs pa khong du chud pa dang / blo gros mi g-yeng ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / mos pa la rab tu gnas pa dang / rjes su dran par bya ba drug dran pa dang / gus pa drug yongs su bstan pa dang /
translated: It is to be mindful and aware, to have an undistracted intellect, to have a sense of shame, to be established in devotion, to be mindful of the six recollections, to teach the six kinds of respect,

original: snying por bya ba'i chos drug gi rjes @343a *//
analyzed: snying por bya ba'i chos drug gi rjes @343a *//
translated: and to be established in the six dharmas that are to be taken to heart.

original: su 'brang ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: su 'brang ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is to follow the Dharma.

original: bsam pa dang yid la bya ba gzhan med par bya ba'i phyir chos don du gnyer ba dang / chos 'dod pa dang / chos la mos shing dga' ba dang / chos btsal ba dang / thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang ma 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa dang yid la bya ba gzhan med par bya ba'i phyir chos don du gnyer ba dang / chos 'dod pa dang / chos la mos shing dga' ba dang / chos btsal ba dang / thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang ma 'dres pa dang /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is to seek the Dharma, to desire the Dharma, to delight in the Dharma, to aspire to the Dharma, to be insatiable in listening to the Dharma, to not mix with worldly people,

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtam thams cad spong ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam lhur len pa dang / theg pa dma' ba spong zhing blo gros yangs pa'i theg pa chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / nan tan lhur blang ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su btsal ba la mthun par brtson pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtam thams cad spong ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam lhur len pa dang / theg pa dma' ba spong zhing blo gros yangs pa'i theg pa chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / nan tan lhur blang ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su btsal ba la mthun par brtson pa dang /
translated: to abandon all worldly talk, to be intent on supramundane talk, to abandon the lower vehicles and be dedicated to the Great Vehicle, to seek the six perfections in order to be diligent in practice, and to be diligent in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rab tu sgrub pa dang / rig pa dang mthun pa'i chos dang bsten pa dang; mkhas pa'i skye bo la yongs su 'dri ba dang / lam nyam nga ba dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i lam la ma nor bar gzhol ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi rab tu sgrub pa dang / rig pa dang mthun pa'i chos dang bsten pa dang; mkhas pa'i skye bo la yongs su 'dri ba dang / lam nyam nga ba dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i lam la ma nor bar gzhol ba dang /
translated: It is to accomplish the four abodes of Brahmā. It is to rely on the Dharma that is in accord with knowledge. It is to ask the wise. It is to be free from the treacherous path and to be unmistakenly focused on the right path.

original: bskul ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / mos par bya pas rang gi sems 'dul ba dang / pha rol kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: bskul ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / mos par bya pas rang gi sems 'dul ba dang / pha rol kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i sems dang /
translated: It is to train one’s mind through exhortation, recollection, and interest. It is the accumulation of wisdom that protects the minds of others. It is the mind that arises constantly and uninterruptedly in order to purify one’s own and others’ minds.

original: khams gsum pas dben par dga' zhing rang gi sems rtogs par byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems kyi skabs mi 'byed cing /
analyzed: khams gsum pas dben par dga' zhing rang gi sems rtogs par byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems kyi skabs mi 'byed cing /
translated: It is to delight in being secluded from the three realms and to realize one’s own mind. It is not to give nonvirtuous thoughts an opportunity.

original: @343b rnam par rtog pa gsum bsal bas lus dang / ngag dang / sems las su rung ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: @343b rnam par rtog pa gsum bsal bas lus dang / ngag dang / sems las su rung ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin gcig tu nges pa rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victorious ones,

original: gzhan yang phung po rnams la sgyu ma lta bur rtog pa dang / khams rnams la sprul pa lta bu'i 'du shes su rtog pa dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba dang / chu'i zla ba dang / rmi lam dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po rnams la sgyu ma lta bur rtog pa dang / khams rnams la sprul pa lta bu'i 'du shes su rtog pa dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba dang / chu'i zla ba dang / rmi lam dang /
translated: furthermore, the realization of the aggregates as being like an illusion, the realization of the elements as being like emanations, and the realization of all phenomena as being like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, a dream,

analyzed: mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / mig yor dang 'dra zhing /

analyzed: nam mkha'i ri me dang mnyam pa dang / mgal me bskor ba lta bu ste /

original: 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od lta bu ste /
translated: as being like the light of the sun and moon,

original: chos thams cad ni gzung du med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzung du med pa /
translated: all phenomena are ungraspable,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /

original: rtag pa med pa /
analyzed: rtag pa med pa /

original: chad pa med pa /
analyzed: chad pa med pa /

original: song ba med pa /
analyzed: song ba med pa /

original: 'ongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'ongs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is without coming.

original: chos thams cad mi gnas par rab tu rtog cing 'jug pa dang / mos pa dang yid ches pa 'di ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ye shes kyi tshogs bdun pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi gnas par rab tu rtog cing 'jug pa dang / mos pa dang yid ches pa 'di ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ye shes kyi tshogs bdun pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh accumulation of wisdom, called “not dwelling on arising and destruction.”

analyzed: chos thams cad khong du chud pa dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes the cause for the purification of the understanding of all phenomena.🔽All phenomena are selfless,

analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / lus med pa dang / rdzas med pa dang / lta ba med pa dang / dri @344a *//

original: ma med pa dang / rje ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / rgyu ba med pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud du yang dag par gzhol ba thos na mos shing yid ches la /

original: yid gnyis med cing the tshom mi za ba 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: yid gnyis med cing the tshom mi za ba 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs brgyad pa ste /

original: mos pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin gyi sbyor bas yang dag par bral bar byas pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin gyi sbyor bas yang dag par bral bar byas pas /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas, through proper application, are completely free.

original: yid la bya ba thams cad kyis ma byas /
analyzed: yid la bya ba thams cad kyis ma byas /

original: ma bskyed / mngon par ma byas pa'i ngang tshul can bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / bdag gi 'du shes rnam par rgyu ba nan tan du byed pa med pa'i blo dang ldan pa /

translated: They are in a state of non-creation and non-manifestation, and they have the understanding that is free of the earnest application of the notions of self, beings, and ownership.

original: zad pa med cing tshad med la /
analyzed: zad pa med cing tshad med la /

original: mi dmigs pa'i bzod pa can /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i bzod pa can /

analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pas sngon du 'gro ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa /

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

translated: “O Son of the Victorious One!

analyzed: shes rab la 'jug pa'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / go blo la dga' ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: seeking the Dharma not for the sake of fame,🔽but for the sake of liberation;

analyzed: rab tu rten par bya ba'i phyir chos yongs su tshol ba dang / byang chub kyi sems ma btang bas /

translated: They are as follows: All virtuous roots undertaken by those who have lost the mind of enlightenment are the activity of Mara.🔽Giving with an unbalanced mind, abandoning those who are agitated and have evil intentions, abandoning the lazy, despising those with agitated minds, and disparaging the unwise are the activity of Mara.

original: chos la slob dpon gyis bcabs pa dang / chos kyi snod la khyad du gsod pa dang / zang zing la 'brel bar chos ston pa ni bdud kyi las so //

translated: Concealing the Dharma from teachers, despising those who are vessels of the Dharma, and teaching the Dharma in connection with material things are the activity of Mara.

original: snod ma yin pa la chos rgya chen po ston pa ni bdud kyi las so //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi thos pa dang / thos na log par 'jug pa dang / log par zhugs nas le lo byed pa dang / le lo byas nas sems zhum pa byed pa dang / sems zhum par gyur nas byang chub kyi lam yangs pa dang ldan @348a *//
analyzed: snod ma yin pa la chos rgya chen po ston pa ni bdud kyi las so // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi thos pa dang / thos na log par 'jug pa dang / log par zhugs nas le lo byed pa dang / le lo byas nas sems zhum pa byed pa dang / sems zhum par gyur nas byang chub kyi lam yangs pa dang ldan @348a *//
translated: To teach the Great Way to those who are not suitable vessels is the work of Māra.

original: pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi 'byung ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi 'byung ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Not to hear the perfections, or, having heard them, to engage in them wrongly, or, having engaged in them wrongly, to be lazy, or, having been lazy, to be disheartened, or, having become disheartened, not to give rise to the thoughts and mental factors that are associated with the vast path to awakening—this is the work of Māra.

original: sdig pa'i grogs la bsten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'dod pa dang / skye ba'i skye mched la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs la bsten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'dod pa dang / skye ba'i skye mched la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: To rely on evil companions, to abandon spiritual teachers, to delight in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, to take no pleasure in the sense sources of rebirth, to delight in nirvāṇa,

translated: It is a deed of Mara if one is hostile to the Bodhisattvas, if one speaks ill of them, if one hinders their acquisition of the Dharma, if one seeks out their faults and mistakes, or if one looks at them with an unhappy countenance.🔽It is a deed of Mara if one rejects the holy Dharma, if one criticizes a Sutra one has not heard, if one does not like to listen to the explanations of other teachers, if one despises and belittles them, if one praises oneself and disparages others.

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa tshol zhing yi ge sna tshogs dang 'bru sna tshogs su rang bzor byas pa'i rang bzo la dga' ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjes su dran pa dang / zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing sbed pa dang /
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one seeks out the treatises of the heretics, if one delights in one's own compositions which are full of words and syllables, if one remembers the teachings of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, if one conceals and hides the profound teachings,

original: gtam sna tshogs rnam par brjod pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi lam mi tshol ba dang / lam ngan pa'i rgyud la gnas pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs rnam par brjod pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi lam mi tshol ba dang / lam ngan pa'i rgyud la gnas pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: To speak in various ways, to teach the profound to those who are not suitable vessels, to not seek the path to awakening, and to abide in a continuum of bad paths are the work of Māra.

original: grol ba dang / rgal ba dang / dbugs @348b phyin pa la ni bsten cing bsnyen pa dang / bkur ba dang / rim gro byed kyi /🔽ma grol ba dang / ma brgal ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa la mi sten /

translated: One should rely on, serve, honor, and respect those who are liberated, crossed over, and at ease.

original: mi snyen / bkur ba mi byed /
analyzed: mi snyen / bkur ba mi byed /
translated: One should not rely on, serve, honor, or respect those who are not liberated, have not crossed over, and are not at ease.

original: rim gro mi byed /
analyzed: rim gro mi byed /

original: yongs su smin par mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal du lhung ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin par mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal du lhung ste /
translated: One should not bow to anyone out of pride, but rather one should increase one’s pride.

original: su la yang mi 'dud cing nga rgyal yongs su 'phel bar byed pa dang / sems can la khong khro ba dang / chos kyi ye shes mi tshol ba dang / ye shes kyi gter mi srung ba dang / sems rtag tu brlang ba dang /
analyzed: su la yang mi 'dud cing nga rgyal yongs su 'phel bar byed pa dang / sems can la khong khro ba dang / chos kyi ye shes mi tshol ba dang / ye shes kyi gter mi srung ba dang / sems rtag tu brlang ba dang /
translated: One should not be angry with sentient beings, should not seek the wisdom of the Dharma, should not guard the treasure of wisdom, and should always be of a harsh mind.

analyzed: yod par gnas pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la gnas shing chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o; ;yang dang yang mnyan cing yang dag pa'i gtam gyis yongs su mi skyo ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //

translated: To never tire of listening again and again and of being instructed in the right way is to avert the works of Mara.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la skyabs dang dpung gnyen tshol ba'i 'du shes ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //

analyzed: sgrub pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rjes su dran zhing mos pas yang dag par len pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To be mindful of the blessings of all the Buddhas and to take up the practice with devotion is to avert the works of Mara.

analyzed: su non pa la 'byung ba'i las nye bar sgrub pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so //

original: bzlog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so //
translated: The activity of the Buddha is to turn them away from that.🔽When a famine of listening to the Dharma occurs,

original: chos mnyan pa'i mu ge byung ba'i tshe; chos mnyan pa gang thos pas gzungs kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos mnyan pa thos par byed cing /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i mu ge byung ba'i tshe; chos mnyan pa gang thos pas gzungs kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos mnyan pa thos par byed cing /
translated: they will hear the Dharma that is to be listened to, and by listening to it they will attain the wisdom of dhāraṇī.

original: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes nye bar bstan te /
translated: They will be shown the wisdom of the superknowledges.

analyzed: mos pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson par sbyar ba 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the Buddha's activity of applying oneself to the immeasurable benefit of beings, due to the extreme purity of one's interest.

original: bdud kyi las shig byung bar gyur na nam mkha'i dbyings las sgra bsgrags pa'i tshul lam /
analyzed: bdud kyi las shig byung bar gyur na nam mkha'i dbyings las sgra bsgrags pa'i tshul lam /
translated: The seventh is the Buddha's activity of teaching the reality of the origin of suffering, when the work of Mara arises, by means of the proclamation of the sound of the Dharma from the sky,

original: 'on tam yan lag nas brgyud pa'i tshul lam /
analyzed: 'on tam yan lag nas brgyud pa'i tshul lam /
translated: or by means of the sound of the Dharma from the branches of the trees,

original: thabs sna tshogs kyis bdud kyi las de dag shes par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa dang / bsal bar 'dod par byed cing /

translated: or by means of various other means, so that one may understand, penetrate, and eliminate the work of Mara.

original: de thos nas lhag pa'i bsam pa che ba nyid kyis zil gyis mnan te spyod par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: de thos nas lhag pa'i bsam pa che ba nyid kyis zil gyis mnan te spyod par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: Having heard it, one should practice with the overwhelming power of a superior attitude.

original: sangs @350b rgyas kyi 'phrin las bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sangs @350b rgyas kyi 'phrin las bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh activity of the Buddha.

original: sngon smon lam shin tu bsgrubs pas mtshams med pa'i sems las yongs su bsrung ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med par 'jug pa las bsrung ba dang / dbang po ma smin pa rnam par grol bar dmigs pa las bzlog pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so //
analyzed: sngon smon lam shin tu bsgrubs pas mtshams med pa'i sems las yongs su bsrung ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med par 'jug pa las bsrung ba dang / dbang po ma smin pa rnam par grol bar dmigs pa las bzlog pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las so //
translated: It is the activity of the Buddha to protect from the mind of the immediate retribution, to protect from entering into the fault of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and to turn away from the liberation that is the object of those whose faculties are not mature.

original: 'khor ba rgyud du 'brel bar byed pa'i zag pa rnams yongs su gcod pa dang / gcod pa yongs su 'brel bar byed pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams yang dag par sgrub pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang /🔽spyod pa yongs su bsgrub par mos kyang sbyor ba mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las dgu pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba rgyud du 'brel bar byed pa'i zag pa rnams yongs su gcod pa dang / gcod pa yongs su 'brel bar byed pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams yang dag par sgrub pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / spyod pa yongs su bsgrub par mos kyang sbyor ba mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las dgu pa ste /
translated: It is the activity of the Buddha to cut the defilements that connect one to the continuum of saṃsāra, to establish the fetters that connect one to the cutting of that continuum, and to establish great compassion for sentient beings.🔽It is the activity of the Buddha to establish the practice of the perfections, to establish the practice of the perfections without attachment, and to establish the practice of the perfections without interruption.

original: spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: It is the activity of the Buddha to establish the practice of the perfections without interruption.

original: khyod tshur shog /
analyzed: khyod tshur shog /
translated: “O son of the victors, come here!

original: bdag dang sems can kun kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par shes par gyis la /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can kun kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par shes par gyis la /
translated: Know that you and all sentient beings are completely beyond suffering.

analyzed: sems can ma brgal bas ma 'jigs par bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs btsal bas mi ngoms pa la sems zhog cig /

analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang ma btang zhig /
